title: Rotational Kinetic Energy - rank kinetic eneryg of

content.question: The three systems shown in the figure are each rotating about the same axis with the same angular velocity. The block, the cylindrical shell, and the solid disk all have the same mass, while the thin rod attached to the right of the block has negligible mass. <math alttext="R sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> is the radius of the block’s circular path, as well as the radius of the shell and the disk. The size of the block and the thickness of the cylindrical shell are both small compared to <math alttext="R sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares the systems’ kinetic energies <math alttext="K sub Block" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Block</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="K sub Shell" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Shell</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="K sub Disk" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Disk</mtext></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub Block equals K sub Shell, which equals K sub Disk" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Block</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Shell</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Disk</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub Block equals K sub Shell, which is greater than K sub Disk" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Block</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Shell</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Disk</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub Shell equals K sub Disk, which is greater than K sub Block" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Shell</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Disk</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Block</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="K sub Shell is greater than K sub Disk, which is greater than K sub Block" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Shell</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Disk</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Block</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="K sub Block equals K sub Shell, which is greater than K sub Disk" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Block</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Shell</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Disk</mtext></msub></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
